definition: see 臨淵羨魚，不如退而結網|临渊羡鱼，不如退而结网[lin2 yuan1 xian4 yu2 , bu4 ru2 tui4 er2 jie2 wang3]
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China
river/creek/plain/an area of level country
to envy
surname Yu
fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]
see 臨淵羨魚，不如退而結網|临渊羡鱼，不如退而结网[lin2 yuan1 xian4 yu2 , bu4 ru2 tui4 er2 jie2 wang3]

common saying/folk proverb
if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
to aim to carve a swan and get a semblance of a duck (idiom)/to fail utterly in trying to copy something/to get a reasonably good, if not perfect, result
fine horse/thoroughbred
petty or mean persons
to stand on tiptoe and crane one's neck (idiom); fig. to yearn for sth
lit. a caged bird in a pavilion (idiom); fig. to lose vigilance by comfortable living/unaware of the disasters ahead/a fool's paradise
lit. lock the door and search for the right word (idiom); fig. the serious hard work of writing
to live in luxury/lit. to ride a solid carriage pulled by fat horses
covertly/secretly
overconfident and conceited mannerisms
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
see 騎驢找驢|骑驴找驴[qi2 lu:2 zhao3 lu:2]
to make day as night (idiom, from Book of Songs); fig. to prolong one's pleasure regardless of the hour
